DataElement.preferredDefinition: An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a clinician that is based on a physical exam, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms.:The act, by a healthcare worker, of monitoring an identified subject and recording signs, symptoms, or behavior._An outcome of observation represented as a text, qualitative, or quantitative parameter, code, image, graph, etc._A term that helps define and render a concept unique._The person or authoritative body who provided the information._The information contained in a data field. It may represent a numeric quantity, a textual characterization, a date or time measurement, or some other state, depending on the nature of the attribute.:An outcome of observation represented as a text, qualitative, or quantitative parameter, code, image, graph, etc._A term that helps define and render a concept unique._The words of something written.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a physician or registered nurse, based on clinical and laboratory data, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms.  2. The process by which a patient's condition is appraised or evaluated. (Taber's)
